title: Remove editor-related frontend dependencies and lock permanent homepage hero strings

requirements.summary: Remove any remaining editor-related frontend dependencies and code references so the frontend builds and runs without editor packages/imports/paths.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean frontend build completes successfully after removing editor-related dependencies/references.
No remaining editor-related imports/usages exist in the frontend source (e.g., modules/components/utilities tied to an in-app editor).
No editor-related runtime errors occur when loading the app.

file_operations.description: Remove any editor-related dependencies (and related scripts/config entries if present) so a clean install/build no longer pulls editor packages; ensure build scripts still succeed after the removal.
Audit and remove any remaining editor-related imports, lazy-loaded pages, routes, or runtime code paths (if present) while keeping existing non-editor routing behavior unchanged.
Remove any remaining editor-related provider/wrapper initialization or imports (if present) so app bootstrap has no editor runtime paths.

requirements.summary: Permanently update the homepage hero headline and subtext strings in frontend/src/App.tsx with the required 'PERMANENT HERO TEXT' comment, without changing any layout/styling/buttons/functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, the homepage hero headline text is exactly: "Of the People, By the People — Realized"

In frontend/src/App.tsx, the homepage hero subtext is exactly: "Whisper is the decentralized platform where citizens report issues, collaborate openly, and resolve them together — rewarding real effort, guaranteeing transparency, and rebuilding trust in local governance from the ground up."
No other homepage/UI text, layout, styling classes, colors, buttons, Secretary widget, routing, or functionality is changed as part of this update.
Provide a brief before/after note documenting the prior hero headline/subtext and the new headline/subtext.
Provide a demo preview URL snippet (as available in the deployment output) that shows the updated hero section with the new exact text.

file_operations.description: Under the home route render, change ONLY the displayed hero headline and subtext strings to the exact provided new strings; add the two required permanent comment lines immediately above the strings; do not alter any existing classes/layout/colors/buttons/functionality.
Add a brief before/after note documenting the prior hero headline/subtext and the new required strings, and include a small section to capture the deployment demo preview URL snippet once available.
